alert.note: Alert for Harnett; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 23 at 11:18AM EDT until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Durham, Edgecombe, Franklin, Granville, Halifax, Harnett, Johnston, Nash, Person, Vance, Wake, Warren, Wayne and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 9 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain associated with Tropical Storm Ophelia may result in flooding. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 5 inches are expected with locally higher amounts possible. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
